title: Sir John Boyd, diplomat whose command of the Chinese language proved invaluable during the Cultural Revolution – obituary
text:
Sir John Boyd, who has died aged 83, was British Ambassador to Japan between 1992 and 1996 and subsequently became Master of Churchill College, Cambridge, and chairman of the Board of Trustees of the British Museum.

John Dixon Iklé Boyd was born on January 16 1936 in Cambridge, where his father, James Dixon Boyd, would become Professor of Anatomy at the university. His mother was Amélie, née Lowenthal.

From Westminster School, John went to Clare College, Cambridge, initially to study Medicine, but switched to Modern Languages.
